alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 21 at 4:49PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...There is an elevated risk of flooding across Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands through midweek... Showers and thunderstorms associated with the Tropical Storm Franklin...now located about 350 miles southwest of Ponce and 425 miles west-southwest of Saint Croix...will continue to spread across Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands through the middle of the workweek. Rainbands, with scattered to numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms, continue to spread across the region. The potential for showers and thunderstorms will continue on Tuesday and Wednesday. The resulting rains will maintain an elevated risk for urban and small stream flooding as well as flash flooding, which could also lead to mudslides and rapid river rises. Based on the most recent guidance, the areas most likely to receive the highest rainfall accumulations are eastern and southern sections of Puerto Rico. In these areas, there is the potential for additional rainfall totals of 1-3 inches with isolated higher amounts. Elsewhere across Puerto Rico and across the U.S. Virgin Islands, rainfall totals of 1-2 inches with isolated higher amounts are possible. This product will be updated as needed. Please, continue to monitor the progress of Franklin as it moves northward across the central Caribbean.

area.areaDesc: Saint Croix; Saint John; Saint Thomas
